abstract: President Obama's decision to deploy troops to Uganda to help capture a notorious rebel leader came after a concerted campaign by human rights advocates.
snippet: President Obama's decision to deploy troops to Uganda to help capture a notorious rebel leader came after a concerted campaign by human rights advocates.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

lead_paragraph: As my colleagues Thom Shanker and Rick Gladstone report, "President Obama said Friday that he had ordered the deployment of 100 armed military advisers to central Africa to help regional forces combat the Lord's Resistance Army, a notorious renegade group that has terrorized villagers in at least four countries with marauding bands that kill, rape, maim and kidnap with impunity."

headline.main: Human Rights Group Welcomes Obama's Decision to Send Troops to Uganda
